page.title: 13Cooling Church
page.content: The second claim to fame is to be found in the graveyard next to the parish church of St.James.The area around Higham,Rochester and Chatham is steeped in Dickensian history.Here are found 13 lozenge shaped grave stones.They are the children of the Comport family and all reference to the children suggests they were under 2 years of age when they died.It is thought they died of marsh fever,or malaria.However,these same lozenge grave stones are claimed to be the ones referred to by Pip in "Great Expectations".Other villages have similar claims but it is known that the lower Thames along this coast had the very convict ships moored as mentioned in the story.
